website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight, compression-style shin guards that offer stylish yet tough protection.
pros: Compression sleeves are slim fitting without bulky padding, and also washable
Insertable, triple-shielded shell provides strong protection
“Sock” style is easy to get on and off with no irritating hook-and-loop strapping
Backing is a pleather-like material that doesn’t absorb odor
Great variety of colors and great patterns to choose from
cons: Run quite small, but fit youth really well

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously small and short across, to rounded to fit, even for youth players.  Really adidas?
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to receive these shin guards but in total disbelief when I did. They are ridiculously tiny. The size medium runs only 3 3/4 inches across the "furthest" part. I have attached pictures. I really can't even see too many youth players who would be able to wear these. In addition they are so rounded you would have to have legs like 2" pipes in order for them to come close to fitting correctly. I'm usually a huge adidas fan but really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Looking for good quality for a cheap price
customer_reviews.text: Started playing inter-mural soccer and purchased these guards. Looking for good quality for a cheap price. I'm an about 5'6" female and ordered these in medium. They are perfect sized. I read a ton of reviews where people were complaining about the size of these. Addias website recommends going by height and not age. I found this to be perfectly true. Size up if you're on the border and you'll be fine. Love that I can wash the sleeves and that the backs of the guards are a "pleather" like material. They don't absorb the sweat and stink! I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S.Grunewaldt

customer_reviews.title: TOO NARROW-won't fit around a 50 lb 8 year old's shins!
customer_reviews.text: My son was so excited to get these; style and color. He has been wearing a shin guard with stirrups and started complaining that the stirrup was bothering him. So we wanted to try a whole new style. Pros: Style, height, colors available. Cons: Fit-too narrow. I would love to give these a five star but my 50 lb, 4'-3" 8 year old found these shin guards too narrow. After wearing them for two minutes they left a nasty red indentation. While the height is the perfect fit, they are no where close to fitting around his (super skinny) shins and have no flex or give to them to make them fit. This is a real bummer!
customer_reviews.author: MEM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shin guards
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my boyfriend, so he'll be writing the review from here. I got these to use for deadlifting, as I was constantly scraping my shins with the barbell. So far, so good. I've used them in a lot of sessions and they've saved me from quite a few scrapes and bruises. They're easy to clean and dry pretty quickly. (I use Clorox, nonbleach wipes on them.) They're solid shin guards and I feel like it would take a lot to actually crack/break them. Good purchase, would buy again and definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: Run small for children
customer_reviews.text: These are for children. See photo for size chart. I feel they run extremely small. My daughter is 4'10" and the small barely covered the lower part of her shin. Returning
customer_reviews.author: A. Eckhart

customer_reviews.title: A little tight but give good protection
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if it's because my calves/leg muscles are large, or if these are too narrow, but I do find that they cut into my shin a little bit. The sleeves keep them securely in place, however, and my shin is protected. I just don't love how tight they feel and how they dig in a little bit. I would like for them to be a little more flexible and have more give so I could bend them a little bit, but they are a decent product regardless.
customer_reviews.author: Lindy Rolston

customer_reviews.title: My Shins!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'10" weighing at 175 lbs. These fit around my shins perfectly with the included wraps.
customer_reviews.author: Sirlyle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shin guards!
customer_reviews.text: My son is starting his third year of soccer with these guards. He plays fall & spring, and they have held up great. The sleeve style is easy for him to put on and keep where they belong comfortably, they are easy to clean, and protect him well. The plastic pieces have taken some hits and are scuffed, but as they're under his socks we don't mind what they look like as long as they do their job.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary A

customer_reviews.title: Seems to run small, almost closer to youth sizes ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to run small, almost closer to youth sizes. I purchased a medium because i am 5'8 and it is supposed to go up to 5'9. It was both too short and also too narrow for my shins. I went into a big 5 so that I could try on different pairs before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: Good padding for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are solid shinguards, though they do run small - I'm 5'3" and ordered a medium. I think these "pro-level" shinguards all run small, as I used to have the stirrup kind that covered the whole shin bone, but everyone I played with seemed to have the same basic sizes. The only reason I deducted a star was because they kept sliding down during the game, even with the spandex sleeves.
customer_reviews.author: Luck

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is hit and miss
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought two of these, both shades of red and in size XS. They are completely different sizes as far as how tight of a “C” shape. I included pics to try to show this. Luckily, the smaller ones fit my 5 year old and the bigger ones fit my 7 year old. They both prefer these over the around ankle type and the quality seems great. But beware that sizing can vary. One minor complaint...the tags are crazy annoying being against skin. Can’t they be stickers that you can remove easily?
customer_reviews.author: RoyalSmash

customer_reviews.title: They do run small.
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased these for my daughter twice now. Both times we followed the advice of others and ordered one size up. My 50" tall daughter wears adult size Small. The Extra Small no longer cover much of her shin and the compression sleeve for the extra small is very tight. The compression sleeve for the small size are much better now while still holding the guards in there proper place.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Nice Alternative to Sock Shin Guards, But Not Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I liked that these weren't the "sock" style. However, I found that during practice and games, they didn't hold up nearly as well as the sock style. For the most part, they were fine and he thought they were comfortable, but there were a few games and practices where he was in a cluster of kids kicking for the ball and the shin guard would pop out of the fabric.
customer_reviews.author: LMS

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, decent price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, decent price, and was the sleeve guard that we were looking for. However, the sizes are much smaller than what is suggested. I have an 8 eight year old daughter who has pretty skinny legs and these were far too small.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great protection, OK fit
customer_reviews.text: These are good quality shin-guards, but you can probably get better ones at same price point. Pros: Easy to get on/off Good area of coverage Great protection Cons: Compression sleeves fit great on first wear, but quickly loosened Even with sleeves, some lateral/vertical movement in game
customer_reviews.author: SheehyCFC

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and less bulk
customer_reviews.text: These are not the massive shinguards kids wear that wrap around your entire leg and can stop bullets. These types of shinguards prioritize small size and lightweight. Because of this it does not stay in place very well. Even with their small size though I've taken full kicks to these and they've held up with no pain at all. One way you can mitigate the trade-off is using electrical tape to hold them in place. bottom line If you need the lightweight and less bulky option then these are for you.
customer_reviews.author: Keean Nash

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: These fit my 5 yo who is built like a tall tank... wears size 6/7. He is obsessed with Flash and wants everything red. He was uber excited about this gift! He needed help the first couple times, but can easily put them on himself and no more bruises from roughing in soccer. Very cool design and he feels like a superhero, which every parent wants to see!
customer_reviews.author: K. Axtell

customer_reviews.title: A bit small
customer_reviews.text: These will work for this season but they are a bit small. We ordered a size up to make sure the guards were long enough. Should have ordered adult sized for youth over 4.5 feet tall.
customer_reviews.author: book reader

customer_reviews.title: good quality, not sized correctly
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a M which is supposed to fit a person 5'3" to 5'9". My daughter is 5'2" and 100 lbs - these were extremely small, they covered less than half of her shin and were too tight for her wear. The sizing is not even close to what is needed for proper protection. I am hoping an XL will fit.
customer_reviews.author: H L Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Nice shin guards
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these. He has grown out of the combo shin guards with ankle pads and wanted something he could slip into and out of his socks easier. These are well made and a good size: XS fits our average size 7-year old, but he will probably need size small soon.
customer_reviews.author: robert angstadt

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I'm a slim 6 foot tall 160 pound guy, these feel like they are designed for kids as they are too narrow and dig into my shins. The sleeves that accompany them are worthless (don't hold them in place- tape is required). Save time and go to a soccer store and see what fits.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like that they don’t have to go under foot
customer_reviews.text: I like that they don’t have to go under foot. We’ve noticed in games sometimes the plastic shin guard moves up and almost out of her soccer socks. Maybe having a folded over piece of fabric like an envelope would help better keep in place. But overall we like them.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer H.

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I read through the seller's answers regarding how height determines the size buyers should select. Being 5'4" I opted for medium. These things are tiny, in length and in width. I can't imagine anyone my height finding these shin guards acceptable, no matter their weight or width.
customer_reviews.author: KatieD

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love them! Such cool patterns and sleeves are mesh so you can see the pattern through them. Would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia N.

customer_reviews.title: Ehhhh
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'10 and ordered size large as recommended by the size chart. These guards are very slim and short, they don't cover much of anything. They also don't have much for padding, so if I get kicked I expect to feel it more than usual. The sleeves included with the guards are good quality, but I wouldn't purchase these again. I won't be returning them, because I hardly ever get kicked, but I wouldn't purchase these if good protection worries you.
customer_reviews.author: calvin key

customer_reviews.title: small and tags were missing
customer_reviews.text: These were small and the tags were missing on the inside. My son wasn't able to use these because they were not certified, and if they were and were on the tags he wouldn't of been able to show the referee so we had to send them back. Also the sleeves were missing when they arrived. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: chunsayaksok

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A WASTE.
customer_reviews.text: TINY. My daughter was in the middle of the smallest size range, and she's little for her age. So disappointing. AND they charged me $7 to ship back, WHAT A WASTE.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: A Little Small
customer_reviews.text: The guards seem a little narrow, they do protect the shin bone as intended but they are a bit uncomfortable to wear. They also slide down sometimes when using them as they are only held in place by an elastic sleeve. They are very cheap though so I can't say that these problems are deal breakers.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Small perfect size for 4’5 daughter.
customer_reviews.text: The size small guards had a great fit for my 4’5 daughter that is almost 8 years old. Very comfortable and they stay in the sleeve. She still prefers to wear ankle guards with them. Highly recommend. She likes them because there is no Velcro strap around her calf; better comfort than her first shin guards. I think she will be able to wear this size until she is 4’10 or 5’0.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but impossibly narrow.
customer_reviews.text: I liked these overall, but they are the smallest things I have ever seen. I used my daughter's height to select the size and she was well within the range, but these are incredibly narrow and would not even fit around an infant's shin. I don't understand how these would fit anyone. My daughter is tiny and we couldn't even get them around her shin.
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and work well
customer_reviews.text: We got these for our 11 year old son. They fit great and work wonderfully. He says they are very comfortable. The cost is not too bad either for Adidas. We are very pleased with them. Much better than anything Walmart has to offer, or other similar places. The size chart is pretty spot on, at least in our experience.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Urban

customer_reviews.title: SIZING RUNS SMALL
customer_reviews.text: I got the XL - The sleeves are tight but the actual shin guards don't fit AT ALL! i actually gave them to another player on the team who has tiny bird legs because for an extra large they fit like a XS
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great shin guards
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 different colora for my 3 kids. They love the fit and how well they stay on. The compressions that come with it are an added bonus. They keep the shin guard in place however my kids say they stay in place even without them. The size guide is accurate and a variety of colors. Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Protection.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Things to consider before you buy. They are straight and narrow, not shaped like other traditional shin guards I'm 5'6 with skinny legs and ordered medium. They fit me just fine. If I was playing forward, I probably would have ordered size small. Very light and the compression sleeve insures that they stay put.
customer_reviews.author: victor manuel leyva-martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight but don't stay in place without help
customer_reviews.text: My boy plays comp soccer and loves these shin guards. He also loves the design. His only complaint is that they don't stay in place. He usually has to tape them or wear 2 socks to keep them in place.
customer_reviews.author: Alan L Miller

customer_reviews.title: These didn't work out for me. too rigid and ...
customer_reviews.text: These didn't work out for me. too rigid and small for my shins. They dug into the front of my shins.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Disney

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and did the job
customer_reviews.text: Man how technology makes things better over the years. bought these for my daughter who as a 12yo went out for soccer for the first time. she reported that they were comfortable to use and provided her good protection while going out on the soccer field.
customer_reviews.author: STi Driver

customer_reviews.title: Slips out regularly
customer_reviews.text: I wear these a couple times a week for soccer. I wear them inside the sleeve with a soccer sock over top of both, but the shin guards seem to find their way to light, slipping out of both the sleeve and my sock regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G

customer_reviews.title: Size is more for youth
customer_reviews.text: For an adult woman’s medium it is very narrow. My 13 yo daughter is by no means large. It states it’s for 5’3-5’6 and she is 5’0. I should have ordered an xs-s according to her size and the chart provided. These are more like a youth size. Quality is great and the design is wonderful as are the sleeves they come with. Just not accurate on the size.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Great guard just a little small profile for me as a defender
customer_reviews.text: Love these but nothing better than my self molded Adidas shin guards from 1997-1998. These dissipate a kick about as well and are lighter but are also a little smaller for surface area than I like as a central defender. Maybe I am just old, but all-in-all they do a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Maumee Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great slim light shin guards
customer_reviews.text: Great slim light shin guards. The sizing is somewhat confusing because I purchased Medium ones (as usual with my clothing) and those appeared to be for teens so I had to purchase X-Large after that (I'm 6'2"), X-Large works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Gives you painful bruises
customer_reviews.text: Just wearing these with the provided sleeve is very painful. The first day was painful and I expected that they would soften or loosen up after use, however, the hard material and the ridiculously tight fit press harshly against my shins and gives me bruises also, they fit very small. But they are light and easy to clean because of the lack of absorbing materials .
customer_reviews.author: Taichiro

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: These shin guards were much bigger than we expected based on the description. My 11 year old can’t use it. He’ll need to wait a year or two. The angled bottom of the shin guard hits close to the front of his ankle so it hurts when he runs. Otherwise seems to be good quality.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mom

customer_reviews.title: 2-3 sizes smaller than labeled
customer_reviews.text: I thought the reviews highlighting how small these run were overstated. I was wrong. The adult XL is smaller than a kids guard, and feels like a vise grip on my shin. By 2-3 sizes larger than you think you need, or better yet avoid this one and find another.
customer_reviews.author: B. Schafer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Shin guards
customer_reviews.text: Great Shin Guards. My 8 year old daughter loves these since there is no Velcro strap scraping the back of her calves, and no bulky ankle guards. They are comfortable and easy to take shin guard out after sweaty game.
customer_reviews.author: BizMomO3

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit + Doesn't Move
customer_reviews.text: These flex a bit which makes them perfect to play in. Plus, the compression sleeve keeps them right in place. My son is able to wear them in practice without having to put socks over: so, in the heat, keeps him a tad cooler.
customer_reviews.author: W. G.

customer_reviews.title: What?!
customer_reviews.text: teeny tiny. I ordered a size bigger than I would need, and I am a petite woman. Still covered like 10% of my shin. And they are so rigid that I could not bend them to lay flatter over my shin. They are shaped to fit over a paper towel roll.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pad Coming Apart from Outer Shell
customer_reviews.text: The inside padding was coming apart from the outer protective shell on both shin guards. Unfortunately, my son had already torn off the tags. I decided to glue them back together myself. I was able to glue back together but it was a mess and the glue took the paint off the outer shell. Probably should have tried to return. I expected better quality from adidas especially as these were not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: John Bolger

customer_reviews.title: inaccurate depiction of size
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure why these are advertised for adults. These are without question for small kids. I am a 5’0” female, ordered a Small and literally laughed when I took them out of the package. What a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Rorry

customer_reviews.title: Run small but good quality
customer_reviews.text: 6 year old loves them. Light weight and she didn’t like the kind with ankle guards as they caused blisters. Should last for at least the season and for the price they’re great! We ordered an XS and she’s just at 3’10”.
customer_reviews.author: MC1053

customer_reviews.title: In the recommended size on the back of the bag
customer_reviews.text: At first my child thought they were too big, but she/he has gotten used to them now because these actually guard the whole shin. In the recommended size on the back of the bag, they would leave too much unguarded and increase the risk of injury.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Fit great.  Comfortable too!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! More comfortable than the other style that doesn’t have the padding inside. The sleeves are super soft - better than the mesh sleeves. I bought size L. I’m 5’10” and these fit great.
customer_reviews.author: debhibb

customer_reviews.title: OK fit but not ideal design
customer_reviews.text: Size and fit is ok initially; however, they do move around quite a lot once you start moving and start sweating. The guards moving around is due to the design: stand alone guards with sleeves to hold them in place. When these wear down, might need to switch back to old fashioned style where they keep the guards in place with ankle and calve straps.
customer_reviews.author: alan_t88

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and stylish.
customer_reviews.text: Ver nice shinguards. They are light weight and smooth to the skin. They tend to run a little small though, specially if you have thick calves like many of us soccer players do. So I recommend buying a size higher.
customer_reviews.author: Ervin

customer_reviews.title: order a size up
customer_reviews.text: The sizing is off on these. I ordered the X Small and they were way to small for my son. According to the sizing chart, he was right in the middle of the Xs range. they were not even close. Way too narrow
customer_reviews.author: PeteSmo

customer_reviews.title: Love these shin guards!
customer_reviews.text: My kids loved these for soccer. I. Case they forgot their socks or if they didn’t want to bring them to school, these are much more manageable and compact and look good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Ian Brayden Zander noble

customer_reviews.title: Way too Small, Kids size
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my daughter, they are kids sizes, had to return. We bought a M, she is 16, 5'2", followed all the charts. Do Not buy based on charts.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmie J.

customer_reviews.title: Confort and very good material and construction
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for kids! The X-small fits up to 6 yeas old! Very small but durable and resistant.
customer_reviews.author: F. Indech

customer_reviews.title: Yep me like these
customer_reviews.text: I got these because I coach soccer and kept getting kicked while practicing with kids. I am anadult female and they worked great. They stayed put and strangely are slimming to the leg
customer_reviews.author: daisysimi

customer_reviews.title: Really nice.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter really likes these. Normally when girls reach the U16 and U17 level of play shinguards are normally missing during training, but I noticed more and more girls wearing these without prompting from trainers or coaches.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey C

customer_reviews.title: Great shin guards, but run small
customer_reviews.text: We haven't field tested these yet, but after trying them on at home my son is very happy with them. The seem comfortable, went on easily, and stayed put while he went about his afternoon. Definitely run small, at least the size S does. At 4'2", my son is tall for a 7 year old, but still quite a bit shorter than the 4'7"-5'2" range that the size chart suggests. Rigid piece is 7.5 inches long.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money. Sleeves are good a bit tight and shin guards are great.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Burrowes

customer_reviews.title: Yeah l like em...
customer_reviews.text: My 13 daughters in depth review. "yeah I like em". All kidding aside. No complaints from her after months of 3-4 days a week playing.
customer_reviews.author: Chrispr

customer_reviews.title: Good for adults, too heavy for kids
customer_reviews.text: Nice design with the sleeves and my 8 year old really thought they looked cool - we bought the XS size. A donkey could probably kick these and the shin wouldn't get hurt but they are too heavy for little legs, so while the XS size might be good for smaller adults they are over-engineered for kids. My son doesn't like the kind of shin guard that has straps or ankle padding, though, so we went to the local soccer store and bought some nice super light guards that fit in these sleeves, problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Confusing listing, decent product.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely confusing to find dimensions of guard itself in the listing. Certain color variations had this info in a graphic of someone holding guard, while most did not. A few color variations seemed to have guards that were longer or appeared physically different than others. Product itself seems pretty solid, as others have said definitely size up. Works perfectly for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Fritz

customer_reviews.title: I had to send these back due to them being ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to send these back due to them being too large. I had originally read comments to order up because of the size. My son is 10 years old and these fit me perfectly but were meant for him. I am 5'10" 160#. I will update when the medium size comes in.
customer_reviews.author: Elroy

customer_reviews.title: Great shin guards
customer_reviews.text: These were for my 6 year old. they Tit much better than traditional ones that had itchy straps and stirrups that my son was constantly complaining about. He absolutely loves them.
customer_reviews.author: ACHURBE

customer_reviews.title: light weight and works great
customer_reviews.text: son loves these but and they stay in place as long as you use the sleeve that it comes with. If you put it in a regular soccer sock it will slide down. they are great for my 9 year old club level.
customer_reviews.author: Shepjeep

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Very good for my boys who have extremely skinny legs. More comfortable for them than the ones with Velcro straps. And those strap on ones just look giant and bulky and I think these look more sleek.
customer_reviews.author: Bananas10

customer_reviews.title: Great shin guard for use in adult rec leagues
customer_reviews.text: Great shin guard for use in adult rec leagues. Would recommend a guard with more coverage for more serious endeavors or for teens. Great value for light usage though!
customer_reviews.author: bustacapyoyoyo

customer_reviews.title: No shin bruises this season
customer_reviews.text: Worn for Broomball. Worked well as shin protection. Stayed in place. Moderately comfortable (okay to wear but couldn't wait to take them off after playing). (Mindy
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Main

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: ok, they doesn't stay in place my son has to tapep them every time to keep them in place.
customer_reviews.author: Leti

customer_reviews.title: Well made and pretty
customer_reviews.text: These work really well, although neither of my kids will wear the sleeves, they just shove the guard into their socks.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Hedrick

customer_reviews.title: Run small
customer_reviews.text: These run at least one size small. They are not flexible so the width won’t fit around the shin bone if they are too small. I would size up.
customer_reviews.author: wildcat74

customer_reviews.title: Great color and value
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 12 year old daughter. She really likes how comfortable these are and the ease to insert into her socks. She plays defense and these protect her shins nicely plus she loves the color.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley N.

customer_reviews.title: Socks are tight for calves
customer_reviews.text: The shin guards fit - I ordered based on the sizing guide. The socks, however, do not fit my 12 year old, they are too small.
customer_reviews.author: Life Adventurist

customer_reviews.title: they are easy to wear
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old uses them n loves them, they are easy to wear, remove n wash, build quality is excellent as there is no wear after a year of use, definitely a sound product
customer_reviews.author: Kunal K.

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: They fit good and sleeves that hold it on your leg are reasonably good as well
customer_reviews.author: gekko

customer_reviews.title: Purcahsed L and XL for Freshman soccer player. 5ft ...
customer_reviews.text: Purcahsed L and XL for Freshman soccer player. 5ft 11in., 150lbs. XL fit well. L too small in calf width
customer_reviews.author: Our neck of the woods

customer_reviews.title: Got these for my 4y old, they are too ...
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my 4y old, they are too long, but he’s also too young to really need them. But he looked the part, and I know we will be able to use them as he gets older
customer_reviews.author: I. Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: The padding was too thick and the shin guards were too narrow to fit over my 10 yo’s calves. They weren’t comfortable at all.
customer_reviews.author: SMU Aires

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: My sons play competitive soccer and they both really like them. It fits really well with good grip. Good quality
customer_reviews.author: A. W. Rousta

customer_reviews.title: They’re ok
customer_reviews.text: The neoprene sleeves are worthless, need to get soccer socks to get them to stay. So far the shin guards have worked as advertised; but I’d probably try on a few sets at the local store next time, price is just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: They are okay. They kind of move around when sweaty. Wish it had a elastic band on back.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Burciaga

customer_reviews.title: My 9 year old son likes them, but since ...
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old son likes them, but since he sweats a lot, they tend to slip when worn under soccer socks.
customer_reviews.author: Sully

customer_reviews.title: Amaizng
customer_reviews.text: Sizing is great!!! Love the material! Totally worth the what I spent!!!
customer_reviews.author: Janessa

customer_reviews.title: Solid shin guards, recommend straps to go with them.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid shin guards. Well built. Sleeves fit ok. I tend to sweat a lot so they were sliding down my leg. All I needed to do was get some elastic straps that wrap around my leg at the bottom of the shin guard and they don't slip anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Dane

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Would definitely buy again! My son says they’re comfortable and they look pretty sharp too! Very sturdy! My kids have skinny legs so it’s hard to find shin guards with sleeves that fit them. These are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda T

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for baseball to catch for my sons in warm-ups. Has saved my shins more than once.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cappetto

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fit is pretty good. Protect well. Sleeves don't keep in place. Still need tape above and below
customer_reviews.author: Stevie G

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! They offer me great protection because the thickness. I really appreciate that the sleeve holds them in place while running during a game.
customer_reviews.author: Maritzza Escudero

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My son is almost 11 years old and these fit perfectly. They stay in place and are easy to remove compared to the stirrup style. My son loves them and I would recommend them to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Brown

customer_reviews.title: Wanted something that's easy on and off and the slip-ins seemed like a ...
customer_reviews.text: Wanted something that's easy on and off and the slip-ins seemed like a good solve. But they usually slide down and results in my son pulling them up constantly. But these don't. Plus, we even use them without the included sleeve and just pop them into his socks and they work fine. However, no ankle protection but at his age it's not really needed.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Arroyo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on and fits perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my son this season. I believe he was getting to old for the ankle brace shin guards. This shin guards are easier for him to put on himself
customer_reviews.author: SGanon

customer_reviews.title: Protect and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Our son loves these. These go inside his soccer socks directly. He never use the sleeves provided, because they are already comfortable and do not slip.
customer_reviews.author: rocky purba

customer_reviews.title: Won't fit adults
customer_reviews.text: These are not for adults. Ordered the extra large based on the reviews, and there's no way they will safely fit on my legs. They curve far too much and the edges bite into the top of the shin.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: SIZING IS INCORRECT!  THIS IS NOT AN ADULT SIZE!
customer_reviews.text: BE WARNED IN SIZE!!! FOR A CHILD IN ELEMENTARY SCHOOL! I ordered a medium for my high school sophomore daughter. These are for 2nd graders! Great product but sizing is incorrect and should be corrected to state CHILD SIZE NOT ADULT SIZE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: HappyFeet

customer_reviews.title: Easy on...Easy off
customer_reviews.text: My son likes how they fit (they’re smaller than those that strap under the foot) and how easy they are to insert and remove from his socks.
customer_reviews.author: UM Terrapin

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: My husband plays softball. he wanted just a little extra protection for his shins while on the field. I purchased these for him and he loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Run small
customer_reviews.text: Size chart said a small for our 9yo but they didn't come close to fitting - we used them for our 3yo 1st season and they worked great. We ended up getting a large for our 9yo
customer_reviews.author: Matt Duggan

product_meta.title: adidas Performance Ghost Pro Shin Guards
product_meta.description: Protect yourself like a pro with these durable soccer shin guards. They're built with a separated front plate and backed with EVA cushioning for total comfort. The snug compression sleeve makes it seem as if you're not even wearing shin guards.
feature_bullets: Separated front plate for perfect fit and comfort
Compression sleeve feels like you're not wearing a guard
EVA backing for high comfort and durable cushioning
